isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - Meritor Medium Duty Front Drive Steer Axle - Removal and Disassembly - Remove Automatic Slack Adjuster from Steering Knuckle

svcproc.title: Remove Automatic Slack Adjuster from Steering Knuckle

warning.para: Some brake linings contain asbestos fibers, a cancer and lung disease hazard. Some brake linings contain non-asbestos fibers, whose long-term effects to health are unknown. You must use caution when you handle both asbestos and non-asbestos materials. Refer to the warnings in the front of this manual for hazard summaries and recommended work practices.

note.para: If the cam brakes need to be serviced, refer to Meritor Maintenance Manual 4, Cam-Master® Cam Brakes.

step1.para: Remove the slack adjuster retaining ring at the adjuster end of the camshaft (Figure 15).

figure.caption: Figure 15. Remove Slack Adjuster Retaining Ring

step1.para: Remove the slack adjuster shims at the adjuster end of the camshaft (Figure 16).
Remove the pins that engage the push rod yoke and the slack adjuster (Figure 17).
Adjust the slack forward by lifting on the pawl and rotating the hex nut.
Remove the slack adjuster and inner washer from the camshaft.

note.para: Before disconnecting the air brake lines, drain the air tank.

step1.para: Disconnect the air lines at the brake chamber.
Remove the air brake chamber and bracket (Figure 18).

figure.caption: Figure 18. Remove Air Brake Chamber and Bracket
